page.title: 14Roads in Dumfries
page.content: 64% of families in our region own a car. This is the highest percentage in our country. The roads form the main link in the area because we have no rail network and it is becoming a hair-raising situation. Since Dumfries is the largest town in our Region, people pour in to work in offices, schools, shops, hospitals etc. This can cause delays and frustration. This situation happens in reverse in the evenings. Holiday times are worse, with cars, caravans and coaches making their way to or from the Solway Coast. The fact that huge juggernauts coming from and going back to Ireland also pass through Dumfries which has only two traffic bridges and very narrow streets results in massive traffic jams, damage to roads and bridges and general chaos. I hope our promised by-pass arrives before I am driving.
